title: Top Drugs Final Mock C â€” 88 Questions

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Selectively blocks angiotensin II at the AT1 receptor, reducing vasoconstriction and aldosterone effects.

choices: Inhibits calcium influx into vascular and cardiac muscle; reduces heart rate and contractility.
Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal tubule, increasing excretion of sodium and water.
Directly relaxes arteriolar smooth muscle, reducing peripheral resistance.
Nonselectively blocks beta receptors and inhibits potassium channels.
answer: Inhibits calcium influx into vascular and cardiac muscle; reduces heart rate and contractility.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits cholesterol absorption at the brush border of the small intestine.

choices: Inhibits PCSK9 synthesis via RNA interference, increasing LDL receptor availability and lowering LDL.
Inhibits PCSK9 protein to prevent LDL receptor degradation.
Activates PPAR-alpha to increase lipolysis of triglyceride-rich particles.
Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase to reduce cholesterol synthesis.
answer: Inhibits PCSK9 synthesis via RNA interference, increasing LDL receptor availability and lowering LDL.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Directly inhibits Factor Xa, preventing conversion of prothrombin to thrombin.

choices: Enhances antithrombin III; preferential inhibition of Factor Xa.
Irreversibly inhibits platelet COX-1 to reduce thromboxane A2.
Inhibits the P2Y12 receptor to prevent platelet aggregation.
answer: Enhances antithrombin III; preferential inhibition of Factor Xa.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Blocks sodium channels; decreases conduction in ischemic and depolarized cells.

choices: Inhibits potassium channels; prolongs action potential and refractory period.
Nonselectively blocks beta receptors without potassium channel effects.
Inhibits calcium influx into vascular smooth muscle only.
Inhibits platelet aggregation via COX-1 inhibition.
answer: Inhibits potassium channels; prolongs action potential and refractory period.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Bolus insulin that stimulates glucose uptake in muscle and fat and inhibits hepatic glucose production.
Pick the mechanism for Lantus (Insulin Glargine) (Insulin Glargine).
choices: Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules.
Activates GLP-1 receptor; increases glucose-dependent insulin.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Increases insulin sensitivity by activating PPAR-gamma.

choices: Dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist; enhances glucose-dependent insulin and reduces glucagon.
Inhibits DPP-4 to increase incretin levels.
Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules.
answer: Dual GIP/GLP-1 receptor agonist; enhances glucose-dependent insulin and reduces glucagon.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules, reducing glucose reabsorption.
Pick the mechanism for Glucotrol XL (Glipizide (ER)) (Glipizide (ER)).
choices: Stimulates pancreatic beta cells by blocking ATP-sensitive potassium channels to increase insulin release.
Inhibits SGLT2 in the proximal renal tubules.
Increases insulin sensitivity via PPAR-gamma activation.
Activates GLP-1 receptor to slow gastric emptying.
answer: Stimulates pancreatic beta cells by blocking ATP-sensitive potassium channels to increase insulin release.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits voltage-dependent N-type calcium channels, facilitates GABAergic inhibition, and binds synaptic proteins to modulate neurotransmitter release.

choices: Stabilizes neuronal membranes and modulates release of excitatory neurotransmitters.
Enhances GABA-mediated inhibition via benzodiazepine receptor complex.
Blocks voltage-dependent sodium channels; enhances GABA(A); antagonizes AMPA/kainate; weak carbonic anhydrase inhibitor.
Promotes sodium efflux in motor cortex neurons.
answer: Stabilizes neuronal membranes and modulates release of excitatory neurotransmitters.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine, increasing their levels.
Which drug has this mechanism? Antagonizes dopamine D2 and serotonin 5-HT2 receptors, producing antipsychotic effects.

choices: Partial agonist at D2 and 5-HT1A; antagonist at 5-HT2A.

final.prompt: Which drug has this mechanism? Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex.

choices: Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors; does not affect benzodiazepine-GABA receptors.
Benzodiazepine; enhances GABA effects at the receptor complex.
answer: Largely unknown; high affinity for 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors; does not affect benzodiazepine-GABA receptors.
